It was great to find another Mexican restaurant in Barcelona that wasn't Tex-mex, but actually mexican food made by mexican people.  Being in a touristy neighborhood, I was a bit skeptical of the food, but I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very kind and the owner talked with us a bit.  She made some recommendations which we thoroughly enjoyed.  We started with Nachos and a side of Guacamole.  The nachos had refried beans on them and tons of cheese.  I probably could have called it a night after that, but there's nothing like being sick from eating too much mexican food, so we soldiered on. My wife ordered the tacos de suadero and I had the enchiladas verde.  Both were exceptional and delicious.  The plates are presented beautifully and the food is very simply done.  They also have a very spicy salsa which I unfortunately had on my finger when I tried to wipe sweat from my eye.  Very effective stuff.  If you're in the Born and want good Mexican food, this is the place to go.  I know there are other options in the neighborhood so you have to resist and give this one a shot.  Go authentic.
